quoteLast: the following evening the Countess Casanova, moved from her professional calm, hurriedly closed the sliding doors between the two rooms of her apartment and sprang to the telephone where she frantically demanded a number. The delay seemed interminable to her, but at last she began to speak.
title: Bunker Bean
author: Wilson, Harry Leon, 1867-1939; Gruger, Frederic Rodrigo, 1871-1953 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: _Wednesday, 29th August._—I awoke at ½ past 6 and got up at 7. It is now
quoteLast: & I am quite ready dressed. I then played. We breakfasted at ½ past 8 but without Lady Catherine[6] who is very unwell. I then did my lessons & then played. At ½ past 12 I went out walking. We lunched at 1. At ½ past 3 went to Baron Hill Sir R.
title: The girlhood of Queen Victoria, vol. 1 (of 2)

quoteFirst: We left St. Paul in the Winnipeg sleeper on the Great Northern Railroad at
quoteLast: When we awoke this morning we were flying through the wheatfields of North Dakota, passing Grand Forks at about 9 A. M., and reaching Neche, on the Canadian border, at eleven, and arriving at Winnipeg at 1:40 P. M.
